question: Determine the author of *The Universe Around Us*, then using the year of that author's birth, identify the singular landmark achievement in applied physics from that year described as the first practical device for recording and reproducing sound; state both the inventor's full name and the invention name.
subject: web_search
derived_ev: Multiple authoritative sources including Wikipedia, Amazon, Project Gutenberg, and Goodreads identify the author of "The Universe Around Us" as Sir James Jeans
The Online Books Page lists the full name "James Hopwood Jeans, Sir, 1877-1946" as the author of "The Universe Around Us"
World Scientific Publishing confirms "The Universe Around Us" was published in 1929 and authored by Sir James Jeans
The Internet Archive listing provides James Hopwood Jeans' full name with lifespan dates (1877-1946), confirming his identity as the author of "The Universe Around Us"
All verified search results uniformly attribute "The Universe Around Us" to James Hopwood Jeans with no conflicting authorship information
The author of "The Universe Around Us" is James Hopwood Jeans
Thomas Edison publicly demonstrated the phonograph on November 29, 1877, as documented in Britannica's '1877 in Science' entry and National Geographic's historical records
The History Channel article confirms the phonograph was the first practical device for recording and reproducing sound, representing a landmark achievement in applied physics during 1877
Edison's phonograph patent (US Patent No. 200,521) was filed on December 24, 1877, according to the Science Museum Group's archive
The major scientific discovery from 1877, the year James Hopwood Jeans was born, was Thomas Edison's phonograph

tier1_result.reasoning: The solver's answer "Thomas Alva Edison, Phonograph" is equivalent to the expected answer "Thomas Edison's phonograph" because both identify Thomas Edison as the inventor and the phonograph as the 1877 invention. The solver provides the inventor's full name and all facts in the solver's work are verified as correct.
